column1: Narasannapeta is a census town in Srikakulam district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. It is the mandal headquarters of Narasannapeta mandal in Srikakulam revenue division. 43 villages are there under the administrative  division of Narasannapeta.
Narsannapeta is located at 18.4167°N 84.0500°E﻿ / 18.4167; 84.0500. It has an average elevation of 18 m (59 ft). It is located 23 km from district capital Srikakulam.
Narasannapeta is a Town in district of Srikakulam
column2: Andhra Pradesh. The Narasannapeta Census Town has population of 26

column1: Population of Children with age of 0-6 is 2663 which is 10.13 % of total population of Narasannapeta (CT). In Narasannapeta Census Town
column2: Female Sex Ratio is of 1039 against state average of 993. Moreover Child Sex Ratio in Narasannapeta is around 937 compared to Andhra Pradesh state average of 939. Literacy rate of Narasannapeta city is 79.05 % higher than state average of 67.02 %. In Narasannapeta
column3: Male literacy is around 85.86 % while female literacy rate is 72.57 %.

column1: Narasannapeta Census Town has total administration over 6
column2: 530 houses to which it supplies basic amenities like water and sewerage. It is also authorized to build roads within Census Town limits and impose taxes on properties coming under its jurisdiction.
